companyDescription:
“Treat your clients, consultants and internal employees well, and never stop innovating.” - Jeremy Langevin, Cofounder & CEO, Horizontal Talent 

Since Horizontal's formation in 2003, these words have been the guiding perspective that has delivered continual growth and helped us build lasting partnerships with clients and consultants around the world.

Adapting to market shifts, evolving technology and changing workforce trends, we've stayed ahead of our competitors by focusing on people and innovation.

As a privately held, minority-owned business, we take the long view – investing in our team, fostering diversity and expanding our offerings like Talent Board, our AI-powered hiring platform. 

Whether you’re looking for short-term support, specialized teams at scale or full project delivery, our talent, team and project solutions will ensure your IT, marketing and business strategy needs are met. 

And if you’re searching for a contract or long-term position, we’re here to help you find your next great opportunity today.

From the U.S. and India to Malaysia and Australia, our mission is to empower businesses and job seekers alike.

Simply put, we help the world work better.
companySlogan: We believe great opportunities exist for everyone.

title: MSR Quantitative Developer
descriptionHtml:
Overview

About Bayview Asset Management, LLC

Bayview Asset Management, LLC (“Bayview”), initially founded in 1993, is an investment management firm focused on investments in mortgage and consumer credit, including whole loans, asset backed securities, mortgage servicing rights, and other credit-related assets.

With over 1,550 employees, our corporate headquarters is uniquely situated in the beautiful community of Coral Gables, Florida, located near the shores of Biscayne Bay and minutes from Miami Beach. The firm has additional asset management offices in New York, London, and Geneva, and loan servicing and origination affiliates in seven U.S. states and Milan, Italy. As of February 2025, Bayview managed approximately $20 billion in assets under management.

About MSR Portfolio Management

The Bayview Mortgage Servicing Rights (“MSR”) Fund along with its wholly owned subsidiary Lakeview Loan Servicing (“Lakeview”) is the largest of Bayview’s funds. Lakeview is the top servicer of agency MSRs in the United States, and actively sources new MSRs across its origination platform and bulk and co-issue MSR businesses.

MSRs are essentially interest-only (IO) cash flow strips on underlying pools of mortgages. Like IOs on any other callable bond, MSRs are susceptible to prepayment and credit risk. Yet it is so much more than that - the MSR owner is entitled to many different income and expense cash flows. On a single MSR asset, we model and monitor over 60 types of cash flows.

Essential Responsibilities & Duties

Your primary role (80%) will be model developer. Model development is crucial in our MSR portfolio management strategy as the model drives all investment and portfolio management decisions. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Implement latest business strategies and model enhancements into production C++ model.
  • Restructure and remodel the legacy code infrastructure (C++). This will result in a more maintainable infrastructure which can adapt better to the ongoing business requirements and will significantly speed up the model development process.
  • Optimize the existing software tools and create new ones to speed up the model validation and running processes, so the end users can get the model result reports faster and easier.
  • Help in moving the on-premises environment onto the cloud, which involves data, analysis tools, and model running platform (e.g. HPC on cloud).
  • Convert the existing standalone tools (using Excel or Windows Form as the UI) to web-based applications, so that they will be more portable, and easier to be run on multiple computers instead of a single machine.

Your secondary role (20%) is a financial analyst who assists us in investment decision-making. We envision you to be more than a programmer and be someone who actively take part in the operation of the fund. Tasks include but are not limited to the following:

  • Perform risk analysis of our existing portfolio
  • Mark-to-market and go-forward IRR evaluation

Your work will be impactful from the start and will only expand in the future according to your strengths and aspirations. We are a small yet efficient team where we expect to rely on you and your expertise, as we do with all members of our team.

Education & Experience

  • Minimum of 2+ years of direct work experience
  • Candidates typically possess an undergraduate degree in a hard science, math, computer science, engineering or finance. A Master’s degree is a plus.
  • Basic knowledge in Fixed Income
  • Strong scientific programming skills, C++ highly preferred
  • Basic proficiency in SQL preferred
  • Strong communication skills
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel and VBA
  • Methodical problem-solving ability with limited direction
  • Attention to detail and analytical mindset

Location & Compensation

  • This role can be based in either Bayview’s Coral Gables, FL or NYC offices. We have existing team members in this location.
  • Base compensation is expected to be $100,000-125,000 with the opportunity for incentive compensation including bonus compensation.

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to handle, touch or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms. The employee is rarely required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

EEOC

Bayview is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of consideration for employment and employment with the Company are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

Silver Hill Capital, LLC is a small-balance commercial mortgage lender offering financing from $100,000 to $2,500,000 on commercial real estate including multifamily, mixed-use, office, retail, daycare center, light industrial, self-storage, restaurant, bar, and warehouse property types.

We know that commercial properties considered small by their loan size often represent a big potential impact to business owners, investors and communities. That’s why Silver Hill has designed a lending platform to address this under served niche, bringing back smart, small-balance commercial loans.

title: Implementation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Global-e (Nasdaq: GLBE) is the world’s leading platform to enable and accelerate global, direct-to-consumer cross-border e-commerce growth. We make selling internationally as simple as selling domestically for hundreds of retailers and brands worldwide.

We are looking for a skilled Implementation Engineer. The Implementation Engineer will be part of the Professional Services team working on integrations with our clients.

As an Implementation Engineer, you will fill in the essential role of providing technical assistance to the Project manager in successfully launching new clients and day to day management of our ever-growing client base. In addition, you will be working closely with the Customer success and other teams in Global-e and supporting live client’s activities.

Responsibilities:

  • Be an expert of the system settings for all the Account managers, Projects, Integrations, and OPS teams.
  • Working with cross-functional teams and related stakeholders in providing resolutions.
  • Assisting Leader(s) in driving project delivery, identify and address project technical risks/issues. You will be required to work independently on activities end to end, including pushing for cooperation with other teams, and escalating when required.
  • Performing other ad-hoc duties to support project delivery.

companyDescription:
Global-e (NASDAQ: GLBE) is the world's leading platform enabling and accelerating global, Direct-To-Consumer e-commerce. The chosen partner of over 1,400 brands and retailers across North America, EMEA and APAC, Global-e makes selling internationally as simple as selling domestically. 

The company enables merchants to increase the conversion of international traffic into sales by offering online shoppers in over 200 destinations worldwide a seamless, localized shopping experience. 

Global-e's end-to-end e-commerce solutions combine best-in-class localization capabilities, big-data best-practice business intelligence models, streamlined international logistics and vast cross-border experience, enabling international shoppers to buy seamlessly online and retailers to sell to and from anywhere in the world. 

With over 1000 employees, operating from over 30 locations worldwide, our people play a key role in our success, and we are always looking for more driven, talented and ambitious individuals to join our growing international family. Check out our open positions at https://www.global-e.com/careers/
companySlogan: Powering Better Global E-commerce

title: Lead UX/UI Developer
descriptionHtml:
Responsibilities

Kforce is working with a client in search of a UX/UI Developer to join their team for a remote role. Summary: Are you a hands-on UX/UI developer who thrives on building sleek, high-performing web and mobile applications? We are looking for a Lead UX/UI Developer who's ready to code, lead, and inspire. This is a unique opportunity to shape the user experience of cutting-edge consumer-facing platforms while mentoring a talented team. Key Tasks:

  • Develop responsive web and mobile applications using React.js and React Native
  • Lead and mentor a team of UX/UI designers and front-end developers
  • Drive the implementation of direct-to-client platforms with seamless user experiences
  • Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to translate business goals into intuitive interfaces
  • Use VWO and Google Tag Manager (GTM) for A/B testing and user behavior analysis
  • Optimize for performance, accessibility, and responsiveness
  • Coordinate with offshore teams across time zones
  • Participate in Agile ceremonies (sprint planning, standups, retrospectives)
  • Conduct code reviews and lead technical discussions

Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
  • 5+ years of hands-on experience with React.js and React Native
  • 2+ years of experience leading front-end teams while actively coding
  • Proven experience building direct-to-client platforms
  • Proficiency with VWO and GTM
  • Experience working in remote-first, distributed teams
  • Strong command of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and modern front-end best practices
  • Solid understanding of Agile methodologies
  • Passion for crafting exceptional user experiences

Bonus Points For

  • Experience with XCode and Android Studio profiling tools
  • Familiarity with Firebase for analytics, auth, and performance monitoring
  • Ability to create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity UI designs
  • Mobile-first design expertise and accessibility best practices
  • Startup experience

What You'll Get:

  • Competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package
  • 100% remote work (must reside in EST or CST time zones)
  • Opportunity to work on innovative, consumer-facing applications
  • A collaborative, forward-thinking team culture
  • Clear path for career growth and leadership

The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

title: Oracle ADF Developer
descriptionHtml:
We are actively hiring for Oracle ADF Developer

Location: New york, NY (Hybrid)

Responsibilities

  • Design and develop enterprise applications utilizing Oracle ADF, ensuring adherence to best practices and coding standards.
  • Collaborate with business analysts and stakeholders to gather technical requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
  • Implement and maintain ADF Business Components, task flows, and user interfaces using technologies like ADF Faces and ADF BC4J.
  • Optimize application performance and ensure scalability to meet evolving business needs.
  • Perform code reviews and implement best practices to maintain code quality and reusability.
  • Develop and execute unit tests for application functionality, ensuring high-quality deliverables.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve application issues, providing timely support and resolutions.
  • Document application designs and development processes, ensuring clear communication and knowledge transfer.

Required Skills And Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • Experience in Oracle ADF development.
  • Strong understanding of Java, J2EE architecture, and related web technologies.
  • Experience with Oracle databases and SQL.
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a keen eye for detail.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Oracle ADF certification.
  • Experience integrating ADF solutions with web services.
  • Familiarity with Oracle WebLogic Server and deployment processes.

title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - Personalization
descriptionHtml:
About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local — independent retailers around the globe are doing more revenue than Walmart and Amazon combined, but individually, they are small compared to these massive entities. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.

By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We’re looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

About This Role

Faire leverages the power of machine learning and data insights to revolutionize the wholesale industry, enabling local retailers to compete against giants like Amazon and big box stores. Our highly skilled team of data scientists and machine learning engineers specializes in developing algorithmic solutions related to discovery, ranking, search, recommendations, ads, logistics, underwriting, and more. Our ultimate goal is to empower local retail businesses with the tools they need to succeed.

As a member of the Discovery Personalization team, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Personalization: Personalizing recommendations across surfaces of homepage, category page, brand page, and carousel recommendations, through retrieval embeddings models, near-real-time / streaming signals, Deep Learning or LLM-based ranking/recommendation models, explore-exploit, and diversification

Our team already includes experienced Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers from Uber, Airbnb, Square, Meta, LinkedIn and Pinterest. We're a lean, talented team with high opportunity for direct product impact and ownership.

You’re Excited About This Role Because…

  • You’ll be able to work on cutting-edge personalization and recommendation problems by combining a wide variety of data about our retailers, brands, and products
  • You want to use machine learning to help local retailers and independent brands succeed
  • You want to be a foundational team member of a fast-growing company
  • You like to solve challenging problems related to a two-sided marketplace

Qualifications

  • 1-3 years of relevant industry or research experience applying ML to real-world problems
  • Familiarity or experience with personalization systems or recommendation algorithms
  • Proficiency in Machine Learning / Deep Learning modeling and programming
  • An excitement and willingness to learn new tools and techniques
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work with others in a closely collaborative team environment

Great To Haves

  • Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or related STEM fields
  • Experience implementing state-of-the-art ML algorithms from an academic paper
  • Exposure to graph neural networks and/or language models

Salary Range

California & New York: the pay range for this role is $162,500 to $223,500 per year.

This role will also be eligible for equity and benefits. Actual base pay will be determined based on permissible factors such as transferable skills, work experience, market demands, and primary work location. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Effective January 2025, Faire employees will be expected to go into the office 2 days per week on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid in-office roles will have the flexibility to work remotely up to 4 weeks per year. Specific Workplace and Information Technology positions may require onsite attendance 5 days per week as will be indicated in the job posting.

Applications for this position will be accepted for a minimum of 30 days from the posting date.

Why you’ll love working at Faire

  • We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is taking part in the founding process.
  • We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 350,000 small business owners.
  • We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
  • We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.

Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We’re backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Toronto, London, and New York. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.

Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

Faire is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. Accommodations are available throughout the recruitment process and applicants with a disability may request to be accommodated throughout the recruitment process. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their individual accessibility needs. To request reasonable accommodation, please fill out our Accommodation Request Form (https://bit.ly/faire-form)

title: C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Dev-NYC- 150-300K Base+Bonus
descriptionHtml:
C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Developer - Manhattan, New York - 150 - 300 K Base Plus Bonus

A trading firm in NYC is hiring C++ engineers to their low latency trading systems technology team. Relative experience in finance is ideal, but the team is open to excellent low latency candidates from out of industry. Excellent C++ experience is a must with STL/Boost, Linux/Unix, etc.

Anticipated annual base salary range is around 150 - 300 K plus bonus.

EOE Statement: Specialist Staffing Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.


To find out more about Huxley, please visit www.huxley.com

The organisations and professionals we partner with benefit from our deep sector expertise, our local and global experience, and our dedicated service. This is how we outpace tomorrow, together.

title: AI Automation Engineer
descriptionHtml:
Conductor is a leading Website Optimization & Intelligence platform. Today’s top brands use Conductor to create and optimize digital experiences that get found organically in search engines and drive value for customers. The platform provides actionable SEO, content, and technical website intelligence—paired with real-time website monitoring—to help customers accelerate and protect digital growth.


We are a mission-driven company committed to innovation, customer success, and culture. At Conductor, success means improving the lives of everyone in our orbit: our customers, their customers, our employee-owners, and our communities.


About the Role:

We are seeking a dynamic AI Automation Engineer to join our growing team and drive the strategic implementation of AI and automation solutions across our organization. Reporting to the Director of Software Engineering and working closely with the VP of Enablement, you will play a vital role in helping to define the way AI and automation unlocks value across the company. Your role involves understanding business challenges, proposing AI applications that drive practical, real-world outcomes, and delivering integrated AI and automation solutions that transform how we operate.


This engineer’s key responsibilities are:

  • Collaborate with CS, Support, Operations, and Enablement to identify high-value use cases across the company and lead the design of AI-driven solutions that address internal, operational challenges.
  • Translate complex business needs into technical designs and scalable automation solutions.
  • Shape solution architectures and technical vision in collaboration with company technology leaders.
  • Optimize AI models and define evaluation frameworks to ensure continuous improvement, efficiency, and real-world performance in enterprise environments.
  • Engage with senior stakeholders to understand strategic challenges, align AI solutions to measurable business outcomes, and shape data and AI transformation strategies.
  • Coordinate with Enablement to roll out solutions, develop training materials, and manage organizational change.
  • Stay current with state-of-the-art techniques in AI/ML and apply this knowledge to your day-to-day work.


Who you are:

  • 3+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering or automation roles
  • Practical experience with prompt and agentic frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, and similar tools. Experience with automation solutions like n8n and Zapier is a plus.
  • Deep understanding of automation technologies, including generative large language models (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, and other LLMs), retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agentic architectures.
  • Strong software engineering fundamentals and Python coding skills.
  • Solid technical background with ability to implement end-to-end AI systems
  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Apache Airflow
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Solution-oriented approach using rapid prototyping, experimentation, and iterative development.
  • Self-directed, proactive, and comfortable working across organizational stacks, taking ownership of end-to-end problem-solving in a fast-paced environment.

_____________________________________________________________________________

Compensation: Conductor maintains competitive, performance-based compensation programs.

The NYC base salary range for this role is currently $95,000-$130,000 per year. Placement within that range will be dependent on experience.


Benefits: Conductor offers the following attractive benefits and perks including: 100% covered employee medical plan, a dental & vision plans, 401(k) with employer contribution, an unlimited vacation policy, 10 sick days, short-term disability, long-term disability, generous paid parental leave, employee assistance program, flexible savings accounts, paid holidays, life and accidental death insurance, and a host of perks.


Conductor LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Bringing in diverse perspectives and challenging our assumptions is the clear key to growth; it drives innovation, creativity, faster problem-solving, and stronger decision making. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, train, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.


Conductor does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. In addition, it is the policy of Conductor to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works.
descriptionText: Conductor is a leading Website Optimization & Intelligence platform. Today’s top brands use Conductor to create and optimize digital experiences that get found organically in search engines and drive value for customers. The platform provides actionable SEO, content, and technical website intelligence—paired with real-time website monitoring—to help customers accelerate and protect digital growth.We are a mission-driven company committed to innovation, customer success, and culture. At Conductor, success means improving the lives of everyone in our orbit: our customers, their customers, our employee-owners, and our communities.About the Role:We are seeking a dynamic AI Automation Engineer to join our growing team and drive the strategic implementation of AI and automation solutions across our organization. Reporting to the Director of Software Engineering and working closely with the VP of Enablement, you will play a vital role in helping to define the way AI and automation unlocks value across the company. Your role involves understanding business challenges, proposing AI applications that drive practical, real-world outcomes, and delivering integrated AI and automation solutions that transform how we operate.This engineer’s key responsibilities are: Collaborate with CS, Support, Operations, and Enablement to identify high-value use cases across the company and lead the design of AI-driven solutions that address internal, operational challenges.Translate complex business needs into technical designs and scalable automation solutions.Shape solution architectures and technical vision in collaboration with company technology leaders.Optimize AI models and define evaluation frameworks to ensure continuous improvement, efficiency, and real-world performance in enterprise environments.Engage with senior stakeholders to understand strategic challenges, align AI solutions to measurable business outcomes, and shape data and AI transformation strategies.Coordinate with Enablement to roll out solutions, develop training materials, and manage organizational change.Stay current with state-of-the-art techniques in AI/ML and apply this knowledge to your day-to-day work.Who you are:3+ years of experience in AI/ML engineering or automation rolesPractical experience with prompt and agentic frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, and similar tools. Experience with automation solutions like n8n and Zapier is a plus.Deep understanding of automation technologies, including generative large language models (OpenAI, Claude, Gemini, and other LLMs), retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and agentic architectures.Strong software engineering fundamentals and Python coding skills.Solid technical background with ability to implement end-to-end AI systemsFamiliarity with containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, and Apache AirflowExcellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Solution-oriented approach using rapid prototyping, experimentation, and iterative development.Self-directed, proactive, and comfortable working across organizational stacks, taking ownership of end-to-end problem-solving in a fast-paced environment._____________________________________________________________________________Compensation: Conductor maintains competitive, performance-based compensation programs.The NYC base salary range for this role is currently $95,000-$130,000 per year. Placement within that range will be dependent on experience.Benefits: Conductor offers the following attractive benefits and perks including: 100% covered employee medical plan, a dental & vision plans, 401(k) with employer contribution, an unlimited vacation policy, 10 sick days, short-term disability, long-term disability, generous paid parental leave, employee assistance program, flexible savings accounts, paid holidays, life and accidental death insurance, and a host of perks.Conductor LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Bringing in diverse perspectives and challenging our assumptions is the clear key to growth; it drives innovation, creativity, faster problem-solving, and stronger decision making. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, train, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs.Conductor does not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance. In addition, it is the policy of Conductor to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified employees who have protected disabilities to the extent required by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances where a particular employee works.
industries: Marketing Services and Technology, Information and Internet
companyDescription:
At Conductor, we’re on a mission to help companies realize the full potential of their website and transform their wisdom into digital experiences that help people.

Conductor is the only enterprise Website Optimization & Intelligence platform that unifies 10+ years of proprietary website data with purpose-built AI to power high-quality content generation, real-time website monitoring, and enterprise AEO/SEO—all in one platform. From AI search visibility to technical health and content creation, Conductor’s unified platform empowers digital teams to deliver digital experiences that get found, mentioned, and cited in AI answer engines and traditional search, drive value for customers, and accelerate growth. 

Conductor's innovative platform was rated #1 on TrustRadius and G2 by enterprise marketers and growth-minded digital teams.

We’re also passionate about transforming the workplace into a force that helps people grow through our people-first mindset. As a result, Conductor has been recognized as a Crain's Best Place to Work for 7 years, Best Companies to Work for New York State for 9 years, and Best Workplace by Inc. Magazine.
companySlogan: One platform for AI content generation, AEO & SEO, and real-time website monitoring

companyDescription:
Welcome to Jobs via Dice, the go-to destination for discovering the tech jobs you want.

This page is dedicated to sharing job opportunities with tech professionals at every stage of their careers. When you see a job posted by Jobs via Dice, it’s a job for one of our many clients seeking to hire tech professionals like you.

At Dice, we understand that your career in technology is more than just a job; it’s a journey of growth, innovation and continuous learning. Stay connected with us to explore the latest job opportunities, industry trends and career tips tailored for tech professionals. Your future in tech starts here.

Tailored Tech Opportunities - Connect with the right tech companies and roles that match your skills and ambitions. Whether you're looking to land your first job or elevate your career, Dice is here to help.

Career Resources - Utilize our tools to build your skills, enhance your visibility, and get noticed by top employers.

Easy Apply - Find and apply to your perfect tech role in just a few clicks with our Easy Apply feature. Simplify your job search and get hired faster.

Industry Insights - Stay ahead with our expert career advice and industry insights. From resume tips to interview prep, we provide the resources you need to succeed.

Employer Profiles - Get a firsthand look at a company’s culture to make informed decisions about where you want to work.

Join the community of tech professionals who trust Dice to help them find and apply to their next job in tech.

To follow our company page on LinkedIn, visit: https://www.linkedin.com/company/dice

companyDescription:
Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys since its inception in 1968. Our consulting-led, innovation-driven services help businesses evolve as perpetually adaptive enterprises, staying ahead in an ever-changing digital landscape. Recognized for excellence in software development, we rapidly apply and scale new technologies, driving long-term value and scalable transformation. Many of these relationships have endured for decades, navigating every technology cycle from mainframes in the 1970s to Artificial Intelligence today.
 
A part of the Tata Group, India’s largest multinational business group, TCS has a highly skilled workforce of over 607,000 consultants in 55 countries and 180 service delivery centers across the world.
 
Caution against fraudulent job offers: TCS doesn’t charge any fee throughout the recruitment process. Refer here: https://www.tcs.com/careers/india/recruitment-fraud-alert

title: Consultant(e) Développement E-Trading H/F – New York
descriptionHtml:
• Offres d'emploi
  • Consultant(e) Développement E-Trading H/F - New York

Détails de L’OFFRE

Vous travaillerez au sein d’une équipe Front Office qui travaille directement avec les Traders et la Direction des Affaires pour fournir des solutions logicielles de haute qualité, à la fois localement et dans le cadre des plateformes de trading électronique.

Vos MISSIONS

  • Concevoir et développer des applications distribuées de tarification et de marchés électroniques en tant que membre d’une équipe de développement internationale.
  • Collaborer avec les traders, les développeurs, les analystes métier et les fournisseurs pour déterminer les exigences fonctionnelles et les plans d’intégration pour les applications.
  • Assurer le support de deuxième ligne des applications pour les utilisateurs en front office.

Votre PROFIL

  • Niveau Master (École de commerce, d’ingénieur ou Université).

Vos COMPÉTENCES

  • Solide connaissance et expérience d’au moins l’un de ces langages : C# ou C++.
  • Expérience d’un environnement de trading en front office.
  • Capacité à concevoir et à développer des solutions évolutives faciles à entretenir et à prendre en charge.
  • Connaissance du cycle de vie du développement logiciel (SDLC) et expérience préalable de travail sur de grands projets de développement logiciel.
  • Une expérience antérieure dans le développement de systèmes de trading électronique est un plus.
  • Capacité à prendre de la hauteur pour prendre en compte les dépendances du système, les cas particuliers et les impacts des changements afin de fournir des solutions robustes.
  • Solides compétences en résolution de problèmes et en analyse.
  • Solides compétences interpersonnelles.
  • Capacité à travailler au sein d’une équipe internationale.
  • Maitrise de l’anglais (écrit / oral) obligatoire.

Notre ENGAGEMENT DIVERSITÉ

Quanteam est handi-accueillante et s’engage en faveur de l’égalité professionnelle, de la mixité et de la diversité. Elle est ouverte à tous les talents et encourage, à ce titre, toute personne possédant les compétences mentionnées dans la présente offre, à soumettre sa candidature.

Quanteam propose un modèle d’entreprise axé sur la responsabilité, l’engagement, la gestion responsable et s’engage pour le développement durable et le respect de l’environnement.

À propos de Quanteam

Quanteam (entité du Groupe Rainbow Partners) est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans les secteurs Banque, Finance et Services financiers.

Nos 740 consultants, issus de 35 nationalités différentes, sont situés à Paris, Lyon, Londres, New-York, Montréal, Genève, Lisbonne, Porto, Bruxelles, et Casablanca.

Fort d’une double compétence métier et IT, Quanteam accompagne ses clients grands comptes (banques de financement et d’investissement, sociétés de gestion d’actif, banques privées et de détail, dépositaires de titres…) sur l’ensemble de la chaine Front-to-Back, dans l’évolution de leurs activités métiers et dans leurs projets de Transformation.

Nos équipes sont organisées autour de 5 pôles d’expertises :

  • Finance quantitative
  • Risques, Conformité et Réglementaire
  • Opérations et Finance
  • Transformation et Organisation
  • IT et Système d’information

La vie chez Quanteam

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

Votre accélérateur de carrière

La vie chez Quanteam

Vous Pouvez Accéder, Modifier, Faire Valoir Votre Droit à La Portabilité, Faire Supprimer Toute Données Vous Concernant, Demander La Limitation Du Traitement De Vos Données, Retirer Votre Consentement Et Vous Opposer Au Traitement De Vos Données En Vous Adressant Par Courrier Postal à L’adresse Suivante

Si vous êtes un être humain et que vous voyez ce champ, veuillez le laisser vide.

Ils vous en parlent

J’ai pu rapidement bénéficier d’une mobilité à l’international et rejoindre les équipes de New York

Thomas, Consultant au sein du bureau New Yorkais (Quanteam North America)

Ayant toujours souhaité travailler à l’international, après deux années de mission au sein du bureau Parisien de Quanteam, j’ai fait part de mes envies de mobilité à mon manager et j’ai pu rejoindre Quanteam North America, en 2017, à New York. Très rapidement nous avons identifié le type de poste qui pouvait me correspondre, validé mon profil auprès de plusieurs clients américains et démarré les démarches administratives pour obtenir un VISA. Durant tout le process, j’ai été accompagné par les équipes RH de Quanteam en France et le staff de New-York pour répondre à l’ensemble des interrogations que je pouvais avoir par rapport à mon installation aux USA. Cela fait désormais six ans que je travaille en tant Application Support Front Office à New-York, et j’ai été promus Manager de l’équipe il y a un an. Le savoir-faire de Quanteam a très largement contribué à ma bonne intégration ici et mon évolution dans ma mission.

Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai pu m’épanouir aux Etats Unis

Josselin, Consultant IT chez Quanteam North America – aux Etats Unis depuis 2018

En 2015, j’ai rencontré les équipes de Quanteam lors d’un salon étudiant, à Paris Dauphine et j’ai tout de suite eu un bon feeling. J’ai rejoint le cabinet en tant que Trade Support / Front Office et débuté une mission chez un client parisien. En 2018, j’ai eu envie de changer de vie et émis le souhait de partir à l’étranger. Quanteam a été très ouvert et m’a proposé une mobilité vers le bureau New Yorkais du cabinet, ainsi qu’une mission chez un de ses prestigieux clients dans le secteur Bancaire. Très efficace dans leur accompagnement, les équipes de Quanteam North America se sont occupé de tout le process administratif (green card…) et, en trois mois, j’ai pu rejoindre les Etats-Unis. Là-bas, j’ai découvert une nouvelle culture et un nouveau continent, tout en gardant le lien avec ce qui fait la force de l’ADN Quanteam : la proximité avec le management (Jean Etienne) et les équipes, ainsi que la convivialité qu’on retrouve aux détours des événements organisés régulièrement par le cabinet (afterwork roof-top, match de basket NBA, croisière en bateau…).

Quanteam a été très ouvert et m’a proposé une mobilité vers le bureau New Yorkais du cabinet, ainsi qu’une mission chez un de ses prestigieux clients dans le secteur Bancaire. companyDescription:
🤔 About us?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specialized in Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Through our core human values – proximity, teamwork, diversity, excellence – our 850 expert consultants, hailing from 35 different nationalities, collaborate across 13 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Luxembourg, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), Quanteam values diversity (gender diversity index: 91%), and promotes QWL (Best Workplace Experience).

🚀 Our expertise

With a dual business and IT competence, Quanteam supports its large corporate clients (investment and financing banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, securities depositaries, etc.) across the Front-to-Back chain, in evolving their business activities and Transformation projects.

Our teams are organized around 5 areas of expertise:
➡ Quantitative Analysis
➡ Risks, Compliance, and Regulatory
➡ Operations and Finance
➡ Transformation and Organization
➡ Information Systems

In 2024, Quanteam generated a turnover of €88 million.

🔥 Our difference

    Historical legitimacy and rooted expertise
    Dual Business and IT competence, driven by expert communities
    Human values and a tailor-made career path
    Presence in France and internationally

📧 Experts awaiting you!
Send us your application at recrutement@quanteam.fr or on https://quanteam.fr/offres-demploi/

Quanteam is an entity of the multi-specialist consulting group RAINBOW PARTNERS. In 2024, RAINBOW PARTNERS had a turnover of over €128 million, 1030 employees, 89 large corporate clients, and a presence in Europe, the United States, Canada, and North Africa. More information at https://www.rainbowpartners.com/
companySlogan: The Historical pure-play consulting firm in Banking and Finance - France and Abroad

title: Applied Research - Artificial Intelligence - Associate
descriptionHtml:
Goldman Sachs is a multinational financial services firm providing securities, investment banking, and management services. They are seeking an Applied AI Researcher to drive the adoption of cutting-edge AI and Machine Learning technologies, contributing to various AI/ML domains and addressing challenges in machine learning systems within the financial domain.


Responsibilities

  • Collaborating effectively with colleagues to advance production machine-learning systems and applications.
  • Conceptualizing, experimenting with, and assessing AI/ML-based software systems.
  • Developing, testing, and maintaining high-quality, production-ready code.
  • Demonstrating technical leadership by taking charge of cross-team projects.
  • Creating libraries and frameworks that underpin reliable and testable systems.
  • Represent Goldman Sachs at conferences and within open-source communities.


Qualification


Required

  • A Master's or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance, or equivalent relevant industry experience.
  • A minimum of 1-3 years of AI/ML experience in the industry that demonstrates your expertise.
  • Extensive experience in software development for quantitative investment workflows in equities, fixed income, or multi-asset strategies.
  • Proficiency in contemporary programming languages like Python, C++, or Java.

title: Consultant(e) Data Engineer AWS H/F – New York
descriptionHtml:
• Offres d'emploi
  • Consultant(e) Data Engineer AWS H/F - New York

Détails de L’OFFRE

Notre client, une entreprise énergétique de premier plan basée à Houston, au Texas, recherche un Ingénieur de Données qualifié spécialisé dans AWS pour rejoindre son équipe innovante. La société est à la pointe de l’utilisation des technologies de pointe pour orienter la prise de décisions basée sur les données, et ce rôle joue un rôle crucial dans le façonnement et l’optimisation de son infrastructure de données.

Vos MISSIONS

  • Architecture des Données : Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des pipelines et architectures de données évolutifs et fiables sur AWS.
  • Intégration de Données : Collaborer avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires pour intégrer des sources de données diverses et assurer un flux de données fluide.
  • Processus ETL : Développer et optimiser les processus ETL pour une extraction, une transformation et un chargement efficaces des données.
  • Modélisation des Données : Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données pour répondre aux besoins en intelligence d’affaires et en analytique.
  • Gouvernance des Données : Mettre en œuvre et faire respecter les politiques de gouvernance des données et de sécurité.
  • Optimisation des Performances : Surveiller et optimiser en continu les performances des pipelines de données pour l’efficacité et la fiabilité.
  • Collaboration : Travailler en étroite collaboration avec des data scientists, des analystes et des parties prenantes métier pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions.

Votre PROFIL

  • Bachelor en informatique, ingénierie des données ou domaine connexe.
  • Une certification AWS est requise.

Vos COMPÉTENCES

  • Certification AWS : La certification AWS Certified Big Data – Specialty ou une certification similaire est essentielle.
  • ETL : Solide expérience dans la conception et l’optimisation des processus ETL.
  • Modélisation des Données : Maîtrise de la conception et de la mise en œuvre de modèles de données pour l’analytique.
  • Gouvernance des Données : Connaissance de la mise en œuvre des meilleures pratiques en matière de gouvernance des données et de sécurité.
  • Collaboration : Excellentes compétences en collaboration et en communication pour travailler efficacement avec des équipes pluridisciplinaires.
  • Optimisation des Performances : Capacité à surveiller et à optimiser les pipelines de données pour l’efficacité et la fiabilité.

Notre ENGAGEMENT DIVERSITÉ

Quanteam est handi-accueillante et s’engage en faveur de l’égalité professionnelle, de la mixité et de la diversité. Elle est ouverte à tous les talents et encourage, à ce titre, toute personne possédant les compétences mentionnées dans la présente offre, à soumettre sa candidature.

Quanteam propose un modèle d’entreprise axé sur la responsabilité, l’engagement, la gestion responsable et s’engage pour le développement durable et le respect de l’environnement.

À propos de Quanteam

Quanteam (entité du Groupe Rainbow Partners) est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans les secteurs Banque, Finance et Services financiers.

Nos 740 consultants, issus de 35 nationalités différentes, sont situés à Paris, Lyon, Londres, New-York, Montréal, Genève, Lisbonne, Porto, Bruxelles, et Casablanca.

Fort d’une double compétence métier et IT, Quanteam accompagne ses clients grands comptes (banques de financement et d’investissement, sociétés de gestion d’actif, banques privées et de détail, dépositaires de titres…) sur l’ensemble de la chaine Front-to-Back, dans l’évolution de leurs activités métiers et dans leurs projets de Transformation.

Nos équipes sont organisées autour de 5 pôles d’expertises :

  • Finance quantitative
  • Risques, Conformité et Réglementaire
  • Opérations et Finance
  • Transformation et Organisation
  • IT et Système d’information

La vie chez Quanteam

Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

Votre accélérateur de carrière

La vie chez Quanteam

Si vous êtes un être humain et que vous voyez ce champ, veuillez le laisser vide.

Ils vous en parlent

J’ai pu rapidement bénéficier d’une mobilité à l’international et rejoindre les équipes de New York

Thomas, Consultant au sein du bureau New Yorkais (Quanteam North America)

Ayant toujours souhaité travailler à l’international, après deux années de mission au sein du bureau Parisien de Quanteam, j’ai fait part de mes envies de mobilité à mon manager et j’ai pu rejoindre Quanteam North America, en 2017, à New York. Très rapidement nous avons identifié le type de poste qui pouvait me correspondre, validé mon profil auprès de plusieurs clients américains et démarré les démarches administratives pour obtenir un VISA. Durant tout le process, j’ai été accompagné par les équipes RH de Quanteam en France et le staff de New-York pour répondre à l’ensemble des interrogations que je pouvais avoir par rapport à mon installation aux USA. Cela fait désormais six ans que je travaille en tant Application Support Front Office à New-York, et j’ai été promus Manager de l’équipe il y a un an. Le savoir-faire de Quanteam a très largement contribué à ma bonne intégration ici et mon évolution dans ma mission.

Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai pu m’épanouir aux Etats Unis

Josselin, Consultant IT chez Quanteam North America – aux Etats Unis depuis 2018

En 2015, j’ai rencontré les équipes de Quanteam lors d’un salon étudiant, à Paris Dauphine et j’ai tout de suite eu un bon feeling. J’ai rejoint le cabinet en tant que Trade Support / Front Office et débuté une mission chez un client parisien. En 2018, j’ai eu envie de changer de vie et émis le souhait de partir à l’étranger. Quanteam a été très ouvert et m’a proposé une mobilité vers le bureau New Yorkais du cabinet, ainsi qu’une mission chez un de ses prestigieux clients dans le secteur Bancaire. Très efficace dans leur accompagnement, les équipes de Quanteam North America se sont occupé de tout le process administratif (green card…) et, en trois mois, j’ai pu rejoindre les Etats-Unis. Là-bas, j’ai découvert une nouvelle culture et un nouveau continent, tout en gardant le lien avec ce qui fait la force de l’ADN Quanteam : la proximité avec le management (Jean Etienne) et les équipes, ainsi que la convivialité qu’on retrouve aux détours des événements organisés régulièrement par le cabinet (afterwork roof-top, match de basket NBA, croisière en bateau…).

J’ai pu rapidement bénéficier d’une mobilité à l’international et rejoindre les équipes de New York

Thomas, Consultant au sein du bureau New Yorkais (Quanteam North America)

Ayant toujours souhaité travailler à l’international, après deux années de mission au sein du bureau Parisien de Quanteam, j’ai fait part de mes envies de mobilité à mon manager et j’ai pu rejoindre Quanteam North America, en 2017, à New York. Très rapidement nous avons identifié le type de poste qui pouvait me correspondre, validé mon profil auprès de plusieurs clients américains et démarré les démarches administratives pour obtenir un VISA. Durant tout le process, j’ai été accompagné par les équipes RH de Quanteam en France et le staff de New-York pour répondre à l’ensemble des interrogations que je pouvais avoir par rapport à mon installation aux USA. Cela fait désormais six ans que je travaille en tant Application Support Front Office à New-York, et j’ai été promus Manager de l’équipe il y a un an. Le savoir-faire de Quanteam a très largement contribué à ma bonne intégration ici et mon évolution dans ma mission.

Vous Pouvez Accéder, Modifier, Faire Valoir Votre Droit à La Portabilité, Faire Supprimer Toute Données Vous Concernant, Demander La Limitation Du Traitement De Vos Données, Retirer Votre Consentement Et Vous Opposer Au Traitement De Vos Données En Vous Adressant Par Courrier Postal à L’adresse SuivanteQuanteam–Service Communication–8, rue Euler 75008 ParisOu Par Courrier Électronique à L’adresse Suivantedpo@quanteam.fr.Pour plus d’informations sur la gestion de vos données et vos droits, consultez notre politique de protection des données personnelles.Si vous êtes un être humain et que vous voyez ce champ, veuillez le laisser vide.Ils vous en parlentJ’ai pu rapidement bénéficier d’une mobilité à l’international et rejoindre les équipes de New YorkThomas, Consultant au sein du bureau New Yorkais (Quanteam North America)Ayant toujours souhaité travailler à l’international, après deux années de mission au sein du bureau Parisien de Quanteam, j’ai fait part de mes envies de mobilité à mon manager et j’ai pu rejoindre Quanteam North America, en 2017, à New York. Très rapidement nous avons identifié le type de poste qui pouvait me correspondre, validé mon profil auprès de plusieurs clients américains et démarré les démarches administratives pour obtenir un VISA. Durant tout le process, j’ai été accompagné par les équipes RH de Quanteam en France et le staff de New-York pour répondre à l’ensemble des interrogations que je pouvais avoir par rapport à mon installation aux USA. Cela fait désormais six ans que je travaille en tant Application Support Front Office à New-York, et j’ai été promus Manager de l’équipe il y a un an. Le savoir-faire de Quanteam a très largement contribué à ma bonne intégration ici et mon évolution dans ma mission.Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai pu m’épanouir aux Etats UnisJosselin, Consultant IT chez Quanteam North America – aux Etats Unis depuis 2018 En 2015, j’ai rencontré les équipes de Quanteam lors d’un salon étudiant, à Paris Dauphine et j’ai tout de suite eu un bon feeling. J’ai rejoint le cabinet en tant que Trade Support / Front Office et débuté une mission chez un client parisien. En 2018, j’ai eu envie de changer de vie et émis le souhait de partir à l’étranger. Quanteam a été très ouvert et m’a proposé une mobilité vers le bureau New Yorkais du cabinet, ainsi qu’une mission chez un de ses prestigieux clients dans le secteur Bancaire. Très efficace dans leur accompagnement, les équipes de Quanteam North America se sont occupé de tout le process administratif (green card…) et, en trois mois, j’ai pu rejoindre les Etats-Unis. Là-bas, j’ai découvert une nouvelle culture et un nouveau continent, tout en gardant le lien avec ce qui fait la force de l’ADN Quanteam : la proximité avec le management (Jean Etienne) et les équipes, ainsi que la convivialité qu’on retrouve aux détours des événements organisés régulièrement par le cabinet (afterwork roof-top, match de basket NBA, croisière en bateau…).J’ai pu rapidement bénéficier d’une mobilité à l’international et rejoindre les équipes de New YorkThomas, Consultant au sein du bureau New Yorkais (Quanteam North America)Ayant toujours souhaité travailler à l’international, après deux années de mission au sein du bureau Parisien de Quanteam, j’ai fait part de mes envies de mobilité à mon manager et j’ai pu rejoindre Quanteam North America, en 2017, à New York. companyDescription:
🤔 About us?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specialized in Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Through our core human values – proximity, teamwork, diversity, excellence – our 850 expert consultants, hailing from 35 different nationalities, collaborate across 13 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Luxembourg, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), Quanteam values diversity (gender diversity index: 91%), and promotes QWL (Best Workplace Experience).

🚀 Our expertise

With a dual business and IT competence, Quanteam supports its large corporate clients (investment and financing banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, securities depositaries, etc.) across the Front-to-Back chain, in evolving their business activities and Transformation projects.

Our teams are organized around 5 areas of expertise:
➡ Quantitative Analysis
➡ Risks, Compliance, and Regulatory
➡ Operations and Finance
➡ Transformation and Organization
➡ Information Systems

In 2024, Quanteam generated a turnover of €88 million.

🔥 Our difference

    Historical legitimacy and rooted expertise
    Dual Business and IT competence, driven by expert communities
    Human values and a tailor-made career path
    Presence in France and internationally

📧 Experts awaiting you!
Send us your application at recrutement@quanteam.fr or on https://quanteam.fr/offres-demploi/

Quanteam is an entity of the multi-specialist consulting group RAINBOW PARTNERS. In 2024, RAINBOW PARTNERS had a turnover of over €128 million, 1030 employees, 89 large corporate clients, and a presence in Europe, the United States, Canada, and North Africa. More information at https://www.rainbowpartners.com/
companySlogan: The Historical pure-play consulting firm in Banking and Finance - France and Abroad

title: MSR Quantitative Developer
descriptionHtml:
Overview

About Bayview Asset Management, LLC

Bayview Asset Management, LLC (“Bayview”), initially founded in 1993, is an investment management firm focused on investments in mortgage and consumer credit, including whole loans, asset backed securities, mortgage servicing rights, and other credit-related assets.

With over 1,550 employees, our corporate headquarters is uniquely situated in the beautiful community of Coral Gables, Florida, located near the shores of Biscayne Bay and minutes from Miami Beach. The firm has additional asset management offices in New York, London, and Geneva, and loan servicing and origination affiliates in seven U.S. states and Milan, Italy. As of February 2025, Bayview managed approximately $20 billion in assets under management.

About MSR Portfolio Management

The Bayview Mortgage Servicing Rights (“MSR”) Fund along with its wholly owned subsidiary Lakeview Loan Servicing (“Lakeview”) is the largest of Bayview’s funds. Lakeview is the top servicer of agency MSRs in the United States, and actively sources new MSRs across its origination platform and bulk and co-issue MSR businesses.

MSRs are essentially interest-only (IO) cash flow strips on underlying pools of mortgages. Like IOs on any other callable bond, MSRs are susceptible to prepayment and credit risk. Yet it is so much more than that - the MSR owner is entitled to many different income and expense cash flows. On a single MSR asset, we model and monitor over 60 types of cash flows.

Essential Responsibilities & Duties

Your primary role (80%) will be model developer. Model development is crucial in our MSR portfolio management strategy as the model drives all investment and portfolio management decisions. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Implement latest business strategies and model enhancements into production C++ model.
  • Restructure and remodel the legacy code infrastructure (C++). This will result in a more maintainable infrastructure which can adapt better to the ongoing business requirements and will significantly speed up the model development process.
  • Optimize the existing software tools and create new ones to speed up the model validation and running processes, so the end users can get the model result reports faster and easier.
  • Help in moving the on-premises environment onto the cloud, which involves data, analysis tools, and model running platform (e.g. HPC on cloud).
  • Convert the existing standalone tools (using Excel or Windows Form as the UI) to web-based applications, so that they will be more portable, and easier to be run on multiple computers instead of a single machine.

Your secondary role (20%) is a financial analyst who assists us in investment decision-making. We envision you to be more than a programmer and be someone who actively take part in the operation of the fund. Tasks include but are not limited to the following:

  • Perform risk analysis of our existing portfolio
  • Mark-to-market and go-forward IRR evaluation

Your work will be impactful from the start and will only expand in the future according to your strengths and aspirations. We are a small yet efficient team where we expect to rely on you and your expertise, as we do with all members of our team.

Education & Experience

  • Minimum of 2+ years of direct work experience
  • Candidates typically possess an undergraduate degree in a hard science, math, computer science, engineering or finance. A Master’s degree is a plus.
  • Basic knowledge in Fixed Income
  • Strong scientific programming skills, C++ highly preferred
  • Basic proficiency in SQL preferred
  • Strong communication skills
  • Advanced proficiency in Excel and VBA
  • Methodical problem-solving ability with limited direction
  • Attention to detail and analytical mindset

Location & Compensation

  • This role can be based in either Bayview’s Coral Gables, FL or NYC offices. We have existing team members in this location.
  • Base compensation is expected to be $100,000-125,000 with the opportunity for incentive compensation including bonus compensation.

Physical Demands and Work Environment

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands to handle, touch or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee frequently is required to talk and hear. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms. The employee is rarely required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and the ability to adjust focus.

EEOC

Bayview is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All aspects of consideration for employment and employment with the Company are governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

companyDescription:
Community Loan Servicing maintains high ratings for residential and commercial special servicing from Standard & Poor’s, Fitch, and Moody’s and is a Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac approved seller/servicer.

With over 500 mortgage professionals, Community Loan Servicing is headquartered in beautiful Coral Gables, FL and has offices in Fort Lauderdale, FL, Bedford, TX, Horsham, PA, and Tucson, AZ.

Special Loan Servicing

As a mortgage special servicer, Community Loan Servicing pioneered advanced practices that help us assist customers who experience financial hardships. Since 1999, we've helped more than 200,000 of our customers keep their homes or get a fresh start.

Community Loan Servicing, LLC NMLS#2469. Lakeview Loan Servicing, LLC NMLS# 391521. Equal Housing Lender www.communityloanservicing.com/licensing
companySlogan: Offering the highest level of customer experience in the mortgage servicing industry by providing easy loan management.

title: Platform Engineer
descriptionHtml:
About Us

Every day we deliver safe and secure energy to homes, communities, and businesses. We are there when people need us the most. We connect people to the energy they need for the lives they live. The pace of change in society and our industry is accelerating and our expertise and track record puts us in an unparalleled position to shape the sustainable future of our industry. 

To be successful we must continue to anticipate the needs of our customers, reducing the cost of energy delivery today and pioneering the flexible energy systems of tomorrow. This requires us to deliver on our promises and always look for new opportunities to grow, both ourselves and our business. 

IT and Digital works seamlessly to support and facilitate the National Grid group of diverse energy businesses to deliver technology which revolutionises the way we operate. As we lead the charge towards a carbon-free future, our teams are pioneering disruptive changes to our industry by working with agile methodologies and adopting digital mind-sets to drive efficiency, effectiveness and bring new capabilities for our internal and external customers.

Our work here is critical. National Grid moves energy to millions of homes and businesses in the UK and US and the technology we utilise to complete that task is down to us. This role is at the centre of facilitating the energy revolution and enabling National Grid to continue to be a leading multi-national energy company. It’s imperative that you have a passion for energy and solving the problems of today, tomorrow and beyond to ensure a secure, reliable and accessible energy system for all.

The successful applicant for this position will be an integral contributor towards this goal and we will support your professional development as part of our multi-cultural, customer-centric global team.

National Grid is hiring a Platform Engineer. This is a hybrid opportunity which can be based out of our Melville, NY or Northboro, MA offices.

Key Accountabilities

  • Monitor and maintain the overall health of the gas SCADA system including workstations, servers, communications’ equipment and application software.
  • Conduct SQL Database maintenance and configuration.
  • Support maintenance and configuration of system reporting services and data exchanges.
  • Develop and manage Scripts and stored procedures.
  • Coordinates with service/support vendors in the repair of SCADA applications, servers, workstations, applications, database, networking equipment, and monitoring devices.
  • Support system patching, log review and configuration/change management.
  • Support and coordinate the repair of system outages and defects with the primary SCADA vendor.
  • Support the design, configuration, the supervision of, installation, repair, and maintenance of the GMS servers, workstations, LAN, WAN, and ancillary equipment such as switches, terminal servers, routers, and security appliances.
  • Involved in the design, logic coding, testing, implementation, and documentation of computer programs that will effectively and efficiently perform various control and reporting functions required by the operating area.
  • Coordinate with the GMS support staff and application vendors, including GMS vendors, to evaluate patches.
  • Participate in department and/or cross-functional teams to complete special projects or assignments as requested
  • Participate in an on call rotation, providing after-hours and storm support when required.
  • Occasional travel to support GMS in other regions and to attend training sessions and conferences.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or any engineering discipline with a focus in computer area.
  • Experience with SQL Server and Databases
  • Experience with configuration and maintenance of Microsoft Reporting Services
  • Experience with C sharp or equivalent programming languages
  • Experience with developing Scripts and stored procedures
  • Experience with Windows Server OS and networking principles.
  • Experience with Active Directory
  • Must be able to analyze operational requirements in a highly logical manner and be able to recommend modifications and improvements based on a thorough knowledge of computer processes.
  • Coordination and supervisory skills sufficient to direct maintenance and repair activities.
  • Must be a proactive problem solver with a high energy level and possess the ability to quickly remedy problems as they arise. The Computer Systems Engineer must be able to respond to "out of job scope" tasks as required.
  • Must possess strong writing, verbal communication and documentation skills and the ability to achieve and communicate with a sense of urgency.
  • Ability to work with a variety of personnel and be conversant with both technical and business-oriented personnel
  • Ability to meet pressured deadlines, time constraints and periodic requirements
  • Demonstrated ability to develop long-range program plans, set goals and objectives, and decisions on program priorities and analyze program effectiveness


More Information

Salary

Northboro: $112k - $132k a year

Melville:$120k - $141k a year

This position has a career path which provides for advancement opportunities within and across bands as you develop and evolve in the position; gaining experience, expertise and acquiring and applying technical skills. Candidates will be assessed and provided offers against the minimum qualifications of this role and their individual experience.

National Grid utilizes an assessment that evaluates the job qualifications/characteristics using AI or statistically based scoring. For more information, please view NYC Local Law 144 .

National Grid is an equal opportunity employer that values a broad diversity of talent, knowledge, experience and expertise.  We foster a culture of inclusion that drives employee engagement to deliver superior performance to the communities we serve.  National Grid is proud to be an affirmative action employer. We encourage minorities, women, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans to join the National Grid team.
